derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent.: from French commandant, or Italian or Spanish commandante, all from late Latin commandare 'to command' (see command)

entry.def: A commandant is an army officer in charge of a particular place or group of people.

means.word_mean: 1. an officer in command of a military unit
